ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The one-term independent senior essay is great.
I learned the process of designing a research project on my own and writing a long essay about it.
This course was a great opportunity for improving my research skills and my writing skills!
Learned about Korean social welfare system and what contributed to its current structure.
Great class to take if you are good at time management and are very organized! You really need to pace yourself throughout the semester in order to get your thesis done on time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think a little more guidance about the requirements an process for the senior essay would have been helpful.

I enjoyed working with my adviser on the project.  Sometimes, I felt a bit behind on my project though, and while the department has some recommendations as far as deadlines go, it varies from adviser to adviser on what they'll require from you.  It would be nice to have a class just about the senior essay like the year-long kids have for their first semester of the project.
I generally liked how unstructured the course was, but perhaps requiring some number of advisor check-ins would be good.

I personally struggled with keeping up with the structure I had mapped out with my advisor, but I think also perhaps a required workshop for all independent senior thesis students that provides information on what they should consider planning out for their thesis might be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely easier to do an independent thesis than in a class in my opinion, especially if you find a good advisor.

I would recommend the standalone senior essay course to another political science student if they have a topic in mind that doesn't fit into a seminar, or if they have already taken all of their adviser's seminars.  If a seminar will work for you to fulfill this requirement, then maybe choose that option instead?  PLSC 480 does require a lot of self-motivation though.
If there's a seminar about your ideal essay topic, then consider writing your essay in that seminar. But if there isn't, take this courseyou have to!
It is a requirement for the poli sci major. I had a great advisor and a topic I really care about, but it's also a lottt of work!
I think it is a good opportunity if you feel the topics you want to cover are not offered or not available at Yale.
Yes! Only if you are organized and have good time management skills to work on your thesis alone. Set up deadlines with your advisor to get progress done throughout the semester
